intro: Lasiocroton bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Lasiocroton bahamensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
